meanings.definition: The state of being able to proceed with something with little effort or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: Having everything you need in one place is a great convenience.
meanings.sent2: I always choose the convenience of online shopping over going to the store.
meanings.sent3: It was a convenience to find a parking spot right in front of the entrance.
meanings.sent4: The convenience of having a microwave saved us a lot of time.
meanings.sent5: The convenience of having a smartphone is undeniable in today's world.

meanings.definition: A thing that contributes to an easy and effortless way of doing something.
meanings.sent1: The new gadget is a convenience for busy parents.
meanings.sent2: I consider my car to be a great convenience for getting around.
meanings.sent3: The convenience of having a dishwasher makes cleaning up after dinner a breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her watch became a convenience when she needed to keep track of time during her run.
meanings.sent5: The convenience of having a GPS in your car makes road trips much more enjoyable.
